> > Why do you want to run unit tests in JWS?
> > Won't the JWS startup time and the deployment slow
> > down unit testing to much?
>
> Call me crazy, but I though it would be cool to provide a link so that
> user's on a platform that I don't have access to ( Mac OS X for
> example ) could click a link in the application or from the project
> homepage and see all the unit tests run on their machine.

Sounds good. I thought about this also but did not code anything yet.

Bernd

> 99% of the time the tests would be run from an ant script, within the
> application's help menu, IDE, or command-line, but once in awhile it
> is handy to run the tests without checking out from CVS, installing
> dependent libraries, etc.
>
> I guess I was thinking of it as the webstart version of
> 'make test'
